items.text: From android application user will add(WRITE) data, which will be converted into JSON format(JSON Object) and then stored in JSON file.

items.text: Java-object will be passed to JsonObject, which will convert the java object into JsonObject which means the value is now associated with a key because JSON works as Key-Value pairs.

items.text: File file = new File(context.getFilesDir(),FILE_NAME);FileReader fileReader = new FileReader(file);BufferedReader bufferedReader = new BufferedReader(fileReader);StringBuilder stringBuilder = new StringBuilder();String line = bufferedReader.readLine();while (line != null){    stringBuilder.append(line).append("\n");    line = bufferedReader.readLine();}bufferedReader.close();// This responce will have Json Format StringString responce = stringBuilder.toString();
